Artificial Intelligence Technology Solutions Inc Collaborates with AWS on SARA Development
data.description:
On October 31, 2025, Artificial Intelligence Technology Solutions Inc announced its collaboration with Amazon's AWS in developing its SARA platform.

Key Highlights:

  • Collaboration enhances SARA's performance and efficiency.
  • AWS GenAI Innovation Center provides advanced resources.
  • SARA positioned as a leader in AI security solutions.
  • Potential for long-term partnership with AWS.
  • Future updates expected on SARA's development.

Original SEC Filing: Artificial Intelligence Technology Solutions Inc. [ AITX ] - 8-K - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: Allison Transmission Holdings Inc Seeks Credit Agreement Amendment
data.description:
On October 30, 2025, Allison Transmission Holdings Inc announced plans to amend its credit agreement to secure a $1.2 billion loan.

Key Highlights:

  • Amendment aims to secure a $1.2 billion incremental term loan.
  • Funds will support acquisition of Dana Incorporated's off-highway business.
  • Proceeds also cover related fees and expenses of the acquisition.
  • No assurance of favorable terms for the credit amendment.
  • Lender presentation shared for discussions with prospective lenders.

Original SEC Filing: Allison Transmission Holdings Inc [ ALSN ] - 8-K - Oct. 30, 2025

Disclaimer
This is an AI-powered summary. It may contain inaccuracies. Consider verifying important information with the source. Please note this summary is solely based on documents filed with the SEC.

data.title: Eurozone Inflation Eases to 2.1% in October
data.description:
Euro area consumer price inflation eased to 2.1% in October 2025, in line with market expectations and down from 2.2% in September, edging closer to the ECB’s 2% target, according to preliminary data.

Food, alcohol, and tobacco prices rose more slowly at 2.5%, versus 3.0% the previous month, led by both processed (2.4% vs 2.6%) and unprocessed food (3.2% vs 4.7%).

Non-energy industrial goods inflation eased to 0.6% from 0.8%, while energy costs fell more sharply at -1.0% versus -0.4%.

In contrast, services inflation accelerated for a second straight month to 3.4%, the highest since April, while core inflation, excluding energy, food, alcohol, and tobacco, remained stable at 2.4%, slightly above forecasts of 2.3%.

data.description:

data.title: Best Crypto Presales to Buy as Pump.fun and Virtuals Protocol Suffer in Market Dump
data.description:
What to Know: Pump.fun and Virtuals Protocol have both seen sharp declines, losing nearly 20% and 15% respectively amid the latest sell-off. Despite the dip, charts suggest both tokens are merely consolidating, with their long-term bullishness still firmly intact. For investors seeking early opportunities, the best crypto presales like $BEST, $PEPENODE, and $RTX could offer explosive growth.

The sell-off triggered by the latest Federal Reserve rate cut – primarily due to Powell remarking that a December rate cut is far from likely – has now well and truly seeped into hype-driven tokens, which are often the biggest losers whenever such a sell-off happens.

The most notable ones are Pump.fun ($PUMP) and Virtuals Protocol ($VIRTUAL). Pump.fun, for instance, has lost nearly 20% in the last 48 hours alone, whereas Virtuals Protocol is down 15% since its latest swing high of around $1.68.

It’s worth noting that these are not isolated instances. Even the biggest meme coins in the industry, like $PENGU, $SPX, and $APE, have each lost between 10-15% in just the last week, hinting at a broader, industry-wide downturn. But before you spiral downward and sell all of your crypto holdings, it’s worth taking a good, long look at the charts, which suggest that the current downturn is most likely just a pause before the longer-term bullish momentum resumes.

$PUMP, for instance, is currently retesting the $0.0044 level, which it broke out from after overcoming resistance around the same zone with a 55% rally just a couple of weeks ago.

$VIRTUAL, on the other hand, looks even more positive. Last week, it broke out of a major, long-drawn downward sloping resistance line – one that had held the token down since May 2025 – and all it appears to be doing is giving a healthy pullback.

All in all, the bottom line is that while the altcoin market is currently consolidating, the long-term bullish picture remains intact, especially with the USA and China now ever so close to a trade deal, effectively eliminating any major macroeconomic instability news, at least in the near future. So, how do you go about building a crypto portfolio in such a market? The obvious answer is the best crypto presales.

These are low-cap tokens, meaning they’re still under the radar and carry a lot of explosive potential.

Plus, they’re currently in ‘pre’-sale, meaning they’re not yet listed on exchanges, which gives them the unique ability to ward off noise from current market conditions while also positioning you ahead of the next big wave.

Here are our top three suggestions.

1. Best Wallet Token ($BEST) – Viral Presale Token Powering the Best Wallet Ecosystem

Best Wallet Token ($BEST) has the potential to revolutionize how people buy into crypto presales. Right now, Best Wallet is the only crypto wallet that lets you purchase new projects directly within the app.

Other wallets, by contrast, require you to visit external presale websites, connect your wallet there, and then return to authorize the transaction.

Best Wallet’s ‘Upcoming Tokens’ section lists all these early-stage moonshot opportunities in one place, saving you the trouble of digging around to find the best investment options. Even better, the internal Best Wallet team vets every single new meme coin before making it available for purchase, adding a crucial extra layer of security that can save you from rug pulls and phishing websites.

Speaking of security, Best Wallet uses state-of-the-art encryption technology and robust two-factor authentication, including biometric login.

It’s also a completely non-custodial crypto wallet, meaning only you have access to your private keys.

On top of that, you have the option to set up multiple Ethereum wallets, giving you the freedom to organize your crypto endeavors however you like – perhaps one wallet for HODLing, one for staking, and another for active trading.

According to Best Wallet’s roadmap, it aims to capture 40% of the non-custodial crypto wallet market by 2027.

That’s why buying $BEST, which has already pulled in over $16.75M in its ongoing presale, could be a smart move.

Also, based on our $BEST price prediction, it could soar 170% by the end of 2030, reaching a potential high of $0.07.

Ride Best Wallet’s growth – buy $BEST today for just $0.025875.

2. PEPENODE ($PEPENODE) – Making Crypto Mining More Accessible & Fun

Right now, crypto mining is not only largely inaccessible to the general public due to its high costs and technical know-how, but it’s also extremely boring because of its tedious and repetitive nature.

That needs to change, and PEPENODE ($PEPENODE) is bringing that change by offering a never-before-seen gamified virtual crypto mining ecosystem that removes the barriers currently surrounding crypto mining while also offering lucrative rewards in return.

When you become a $PEPENODE holder, you get access to an empty virtual server room. The next step is to go shopping and grab some meme nodes, and this is where things get exciting.

Every node is unique in terms of its characteristics, mining quality, and compatibility with other nodes, meaning you’ll need to experiment and fine-tune to build the perfect mining setup for yourself.

Furthermore, PEPENODE ranks its miners on a leaderboard, which ultimately determines the rewards they receive.

These rewards include free $PEPENODE, $PEPE, and $FARTCOIN tokens, all of which are strong and explosive meme coins in their own right. Here’s our step-by-step guide on how to buy PEPENODE for just $0.0011272 and stake it for a chunky 642% APY.

All you have to do is make sure your mining setup outperforms the rest, and then wait for the completion of PEPENODE’s TGE (Token Generation Event) – that’s when the rewards go live and are distributed.

A $100 investment into PEPENODE today could turn into $700 by the end of 2026 – according to our PEPENODE price prediction.

Join the biggest crypto mining revolution yet – grab your $PEPENODE tokens today!

3. Remittix ($RTX) – Unique PayFi Solution Bridging Crypto and Fiat

There’s a reason Remittix ($RTX) has been able to attract over $27.76M from investors in its ongoing presale.

After all, its mission is to transform the cross-border payments market by creating the perfect synergy between cryptocurrency and fiat.

Remittix allows you to send crypto directly to fiat-based bank accounts around the world. The receiving party gets the funds in fiat currency, completely unaware that the transaction originated as crypto.

By doing so, Remittix hits two targets with one arrow. It lets the receiver, who might be in a crypto-unfriendly region, safely receive fiat currency, while allowing the sender to comfortably pay using cryptocurrency.

On top of that, Remittix charges zero forex fees and offers same-day transaction processing, solving two of the biggest issues that plague the current banking system.

Buy $RTX today for just $0.1166 – and be part of a game-changing new cryptocurrency project.Recap: With hype-driven tokens proving remarkably resilient amid a broader market downturn, the future for emerging low-cap presale gems like Best Wallet Token ($BEST), PEPENODE ($PEPENODE), and Remittix ($RTX) look overarchingly bright.

data.title: flooidCX Corp. SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Quantum Energy Corporation, formerly known as flooidCX Corp., has released its 2024 10-K report, showcasing significant financial growth and strategic pivots. The company, which has transitioned from customer-business communications to the development and sale of private electricity generating equipment, is now focused on revolutionizing distributed direct electrical energy systems with its advanced technologies.

Financial Highlights

  • Revenue: $8.0 million, an increase from $6.5 million in 2023, primarily from the sale of Licensed Distributorships.
  • Operating Income (loss): $1.392 million, a decrease from $6.016 million in 2023, due to increased operating expenses.
  • Net Income (loss): $1.780 million, up from $0.794 million in 2023, driven by higher revenue and other income.
  • Net Income (loss) Per Share: Basic $0.04, Diluted $0.03, reflecting the company's improved profitability.

Business Highlights

  • Corporate History and Name Changes: The company, originally incorporated as Baixo Relocation Services, Inc. in 2014, has undergone several name changes, becoming Gripevine Inc. in 2016, flooidCX Corp. in 2019, and most recently, Quantum Energy Corporation in 2024, reflecting its strategic pivot towards energy solutions.
  • Change in Control and Strategic Pivot: In July 2022, flooidCX Corp. experienced a change in control when MP Special Purpose Corp. acquired a significant ownership stake, leading to a strategic shift towards the development and sale of private electricity generating equipment.
  • Business Operations and Technology: Quantum Energy Corporation focuses on distributed direct electrical energy systems with its exclusively licensed and patent-pending technologies, including Harvested and Thermal Electrical Energy Collection and Transmission (EET), Photon Lighting Systems, and other advanced energy solutions.
  • Product Offerings: The company's product line includes EET technology, Photon Lighting Systems, Photovoltaic Systems, Thermal Energy Harvesting, Photon Engines, and energy storage systems, designed to enhance energy efficiency and sustainability.
  • Market Opportunity: The demand for sustainable and efficient energy solutions is increasing due to global efforts to reduce carbon emissions and enhance energy security, positioning Quantum at the forefront of this market shift.
  • Rare Earth and Magnet Involvement: Quantum is involved in the recycling and processing of rare earth materials, including magnets, essential for high-quality electrical devices.
  • Marketing Strategies: The company employs a comprehensive marketing strategy focusing on technological innovations, sustainability credentials, and strategic partnerships.
  • Future Outlook: Quantum plans to increase its installation fees and recurring revenue contracts significantly in 2025, with a focus on expanding its manufacturing capacity and market reach through customer and investor capital.
  • Geographical Expansion: The company has begun installations in Arizona, Texas, Nevada, and Wyoming, and is negotiating additional distributorships in various U.S. states and international markets, including Canada and Mexico.
  • New Product Launches: Quantum has introduced several new products, including the SAFEwatt ethernet power adapter and Photon Lighting Systems that transform lighting fixtures into energy generators.
  • New Production Launches: The company has initiated Direct Energy System installations in multiple states, with plans to expand its production capabilities to meet growing demand.

Strategic Initiatives

  • The company has focused on expanding its market presence through the sale of Licensed Distributorships, both exclusive and non-exclusive, generating significant revenue.
  • Engaged in strategic partnerships and licensing agreements, such as the cross-license acquisition valued at $8.5 million, to enhance its technological capabilities.
  • Actively pursuing new markets, evidenced by negotiations for additional distributorships in various U.S. states and international territories like Canada and Mexico.
  • Managed its capital through the sale of distributor licenses, providing a steady revenue stream to cover operating expenses, and strategically managed its debt, with notes payable totaling approximately $6 million as of December 31, 2024.
  • Plans to increase its installation fees and recurring revenue contracts significantly in 2025, with projections exceeding $150 million and $100 million, respectively.
  • Anticipates improved liquidity as customer and investor capital becomes available, supporting its growth initiatives.
  • Exploring new licensing opportunities in international markets, which could further enhance its revenue and market position.

Challenges and Risks

  • The strategic pivot to the development and sale of private electricity generating equipment introduces operational risks associated with entering a new market segment.
  • The focus on sustainable energy solutions and rare earth material recycling presents both opportunities and challenges in terms of market acceptance and technological execution.
  • Significant increase in operating expenses due to ramp-up in operations, including increased advertising, wages, and research and development costs, which could impact profitability if revenue growth does not keep pace.
  • Reliance on the sale of distributor licenses as the sole revenue stream presents a risk if market demand for these licenses declines.
  • Limited liquidity and the ability to meet capital demands are contingent on securing customer or investor financing for installations.
  • Limited plans to offer equity or take on additional debt, which could constrain the ability to respond to unforeseen financial challenges.
  • Exposure to market risks related to fluctuating energy prices, regulatory changes, and technological advancements, with strategies to mitigate these risks including securing long-term contracts and focusing on proprietary technologies.

SEC Filing: flooidCX Corp. [ FLCX ] - 10-K - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: Winnebago Initiated at Hold by Loop Capital
T-REX Acquisition Corp. SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
T-REX Acquisition Corp., a company focused on cryptocurrency mining and blockchain infrastructure, has released its annual Form 10-K report. The report provides a comprehensive overview of the company's financial performance, business operations, strategic initiatives, and the challenges it faces in the evolving cryptocurrency industry.

Financial Highlights

Total Revenues: $32,390, an increase of 105% from the previous year, primarily due to recommencing mining operations at the newly acquired co-location facility.

Gross Loss: $(86,202), compared to $(14,434) in the previous year, reflecting increased costs associated with the expansion of mining operations.

Loss from Operations: $(2,115,391), compared to $(995,813) in the previous year, driven by higher operating expenses including stock-based compensation and increased professional fees.

Net Loss: $(2,535,552), compared to $(1,023,271) in the previous year, primarily due to a substantial increase in stock-based compensation and a decline in depreciation expense.

Basic and Dilutive Net Loss Per Share: $(0.13), compared to $(0.06) in the previous year, reflecting the increased net loss.

Business Highlights

Business Focus and Strategy: T-REX Acquisition Corp. has pivoted its strategic focus to secure and operate within the Bitcoin distributed ledger network, exploring additional distributed ledger protocols and infrastructure opportunities. The company began earning Bitcoin mining rewards on February 17, 2022, and generally converts received BTC into U.S. dollars or uses it for payments to third parties.

Cryptocurrency Mining Operations: The company operates its cryptocurrency mining operations through its subsidiary, Raptor Mining LLC, which includes proprietary Bitcoin mining operations and virtual asset acquisitions. Raptor is responsible for validating blockchain transactions in exchange for mining rewards.

Co-location Hosting Services: Through its subsidiary Megalodon Mining and Electric LLC, T-REX provides co-location hosting services to third-party customers, primarily digital asset mining businesses. This includes the provision of physical space and supporting infrastructure within its mining facility.

New Production Launches: In March 2025, Megalodon acquired a data center and co-location facility in Orofino, Idaho, which supports the company's hosting business model by offering third-party crypto miners support to operate mining operations without purchasing a facility of their own.

Modular Infrastructure Development: Sabretooth Mining Containers LLC, a subsidiary formed in February 2025, is focused on designing and fabricating modular containers equipped with electrical and racking infrastructure to support off-site cryptocurrency mining operations.

Software Development: Deinodon Mining Solutions LLC, another subsidiary, provides software and technical resources for cryptocurrency operations. The company acquired proprietary software from Baoblock, Inc. to support its crypto-mining and operational infrastructure.

Future Outlook: T-REX plans to extend its revenue streams beyond direct crypto mining into other segments of the industry, such as collocation hosting, equipment sales, infrastructure development, software-as-a-service (SaaS), power curtailments, and renewable energy credits. The company aims to leverage strategic partnerships and other business opportunities in the blockchain infrastructure space.

Strategic Initiatives

Strategic Initiatives: T-Rex Acquisition Corp. is focusing on expanding its operations in the cryptocurrency sector, particularly through the acquisition and development of data centers and co-location facilities. The company acquired a data center in Orofino, Idaho, and is planning to secure 275 latest generation ASIC miners to enhance its mining capabilities. Additionally, the company is exploring opportunities in distributed ledger protocols and infrastructure, aiming to secure and operate within the Bitcoin network.

Capital Management: The company has been actively managing its capital through various financing activities, including the issuance of convertible notes and common stock to raise funds. During the fiscal year, T-Rex raised $1,184,067 through financing activities, which included proceeds from the issuance of notes payable to related and unrelated parties. The company also issued shares for cash and as compensation for services, contributing to an increase in additional paid-in capital. Furthermore, the company has been converting notes payable into equity to manage its liabilities and improve its balance sheet.

Future Outlook: T-Rex plans to continue funding its working capital requirements through the sale of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, as well as through the sale of restricted common stock. The company anticipates that its working capital needs will grow in line with its business expansion. T-Rex is also considering raising additional capital through public or private offerings to support its strategic initiatives and ensure its ability to continue as a going concern. The company is focused on enhancing its liquidity and capital resources to support future business operations and expansion.

Challenges and Risks

Operational Risks: The company has shifted its focus to a blockchain and cryptocurrency mining business, which is new and unproven. This strategic pivot introduces significant operational risks due to the nascent and evolving nature of the industry.

Market and Technological Risks: The company faces several risks related to its cryptocurrency mining operations, including the potential for Bitcoin to be supplanted by other cryptocurrencies, which could negatively impact demand and conversion spot prices. Additionally, the company relies on ASIC chips designed exclusively for Bitcoin mining, which could lead to increased costs if reconfiguration or replacement is necessary due to a decline in Bitcoin demand.

Regulatory Risks: Regulatory risks are significant, as changes in regulations or interpretations could require the company to register as a money services business or comply with additional federal or state regulations, potentially incurring prohibitive compliance costs.

Security Risks: The company is also exposed to risks related to the security of digital assets, as exchanges and large holders must adapt to technological changes to safeguard assets. The lack of insurance protection for digital assets further exposes the company to potential losses.

Financial and Market Risks: The company has not generated significant revenue and has incurred recurring losses, raising concerns about its ability to continue as a going concern. The volatility of cryptocurrencies introduces risks in asset valuation and revenue predictability, with significant price drops potentially impacting transaction volumes and liquidity.

Operational Challenges: The company faces operational challenges in securing mining equipment and accessing affordable energy resources, which are critical for maintaining competitiveness. Rising interest rates and inflation could also impact investor demand for cryptocurrencies and operational costs.

Market Risks: The company is exposed to market risks, including fluctuations in cryptocurrency values and potential regulatory changes, which could impact financial projections and overall market dynamics. The shift towards decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols and environmental concerns related to Proof-of-Work cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin could further influence market conditions and investor behavior.

SEC Filing: T-REX Acquisition Corp. [ TRXA ] - 10-K - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: Apple Inc. SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Apple Inc., a global leader in technology and innovation, has released its 2025 10-K report, showcasing a year of robust financial performance, strategic product launches, and ongoing efforts to navigate a complex market environment. The report provides a comprehensive overview of the company's financial health, business operations, strategic initiatives, and the challenges it faces in the competitive tech industry.

Financial Highlights

Apple Inc. reported impressive financial results for the fiscal year 2025:

  • Total net sales: $416,161 million, reflecting a 6% increase from the previous year, driven by higher net sales of iPhone and Services.
  • Gross margin: $195,201 million, with a gross margin percentage of 46.9%, indicating an improvement due to favorable costs and a different mix of products.
  • Operating income: $133,050 million, showing a strong performance with increased sales and effective cost management.
  • Net income: $112,010 million, benefiting from a lower effective tax rate primarily due to a lower effective tax rate on foreign earnings.
  • Diluted EPS: $7.46, up from $6.08 in the previous year, reflecting the company's strong financial performance and share repurchase activities.

Business Highlights

Apple Inc. continued to excel in various aspects of its business operations:

  • Revenue Segments: The company reported revenue from various product lines including iPhone, Mac, iPad, Wearables, Home and Accessories, and Services. Each product line contributed differently to the overall revenue, with iPhone and Services showing significant growth.
  • Geographical Performance: The Americas region saw an increase in net sales primarily due to higher sales of iPhone and Services. Europe also experienced growth driven by increased sales of Services, iPhone, and Mac. In contrast, Greater China saw a decline in net sales due to lower iPhone sales, although this was partially offset by higher Mac sales. Japan and the Rest of Asia Pacific regions reported increased net sales, driven by higher sales of iPhone, Services, and Mac.
  • New Product Launches: During fiscal year 2025, the company launched several new products including the iPhone 17 series, Apple Watch Series 11, and AirPods Pro 3. Additionally, new versions of operating systems such as iOS 26, macOS Tahoe 26, and others were released.
  • Future Outlook: The company is focused on expanding its market opportunities in smartphones, personal computers, tablets, wearables, and services. It anticipates continued competition and aims to maintain its competitive edge through innovation and the introduction of new products and services.
  • Supply Chain and Component Availability: The company faces challenges in component supply, with certain components being sourced from single or limited suppliers. This situation is exacerbated by industry-wide shortages and pricing fluctuations, which could impact production and product availability.
  • Research and Development: The company continues to invest heavily in research and development to drive innovation and maintain its competitive position. This includes developing new technologies and enhancing existing products and services.
  • Human Capital: The company emphasizes the importance of its workforce, focusing on attracting, developing, and retaining talent. It offers competitive compensation and benefits, and invests in employee development through programs like Apple University.

Strategic Initiatives

Apple Inc. announced several strategic initiatives aimed at enhancing its product offerings and market presence:

  • Product Launches: In 2025, the company introduced new products such as the iPhone 17 series, Apple Watch Series 11, and updated versions of the MacBook and iPad lines. These product launches are part of Apple's ongoing strategy to maintain its competitive edge in the technology sector.
  • Services Expansion: Apple is focusing on expanding its services segment, which saw a significant increase in net sales due to higher revenue from advertising, the App Store, and cloud services.
  • Capital Management: Apple Inc. engaged in substantial capital management activities during 2025. The company repurchased $89.3 billion of its common stock as part of its share repurchase program, which was expanded with a new authorization of up to $100 billion. Apple also increased its quarterly dividend from $0.25 to $0.26 per share, reflecting its commitment to returning capital to shareholders. The company maintained a strong liquidity position with $132.4 billion in cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities as of September 27, 2025. Additionally, Apple managed its debt portfolio by issuing new fixed-rate notes and repaying portions of its outstanding term debt.
  • Future Outlook: Looking ahead, Apple Inc. plans to continue its capital return program, with intentions to increase its dividend on an annual basis, subject to board approval. The company is also evaluating the adoption of new accounting standards that could impact its financial reporting in the coming years. Apple remains focused on navigating macroeconomic challenges, including tariffs and currency fluctuations, which could affect its supply chain and pricing strategies. The company aims to leverage its strong financial position to invest in innovation and sustain its growth trajectory.

Challenges and Risks

Apple Inc. faces several challenges and risks in its operations:

  • Macroeconomic and Industry Risks: The company's performance is significantly influenced by global economic conditions. Adverse conditions such as inflation, high unemployment, and currency fluctuations can negatively impact consumer spending and demand for the company's products. Political events, trade disputes, and geopolitical tensions can disrupt the company's supply chain and increase costs.
  • Operational Risks: The company faces risks related to the introduction and transition of new products and services. Managing these transitions effectively is critical to stimulating customer demand and maintaining market position. The company also depends on third-party software developers, and any reduction in support could impact product sales.
  • Regulatory Risks: The company is subject to complex and evolving laws worldwide, including those related to privacy, data security, and antitrust. Compliance with these regulations is costly and can limit the company's ability to offer certain products and services. The company is also exposed to legal proceedings and government investigations, which can result in significant financial and operational impacts.
  • Emerging Risks: The introduction of new tariffs and trade measures, particularly those affecting imports from key manufacturing regions, poses a significant risk to the company's supply chain and cost structure. Additionally, the increasing frequency and sophistication of cybersecurity attacks present ongoing challenges to data security and business continuity.
  • Management Strategies: Management has highlighted the impact of new U.S. tariffs on imports from several countries, which could affect the company's supply chain and product pricing. The company is also navigating macroeconomic pressures such as inflation and currency fluctuations, which have direct and indirect effects on financial performance. Management is focused on maintaining a strong balance sheet and believes its cash reserves and access to debt markets will support ongoing operations and strategic initiatives.
  • Market Risks: The company is exposed to foreign currency exchange rate fluctuations, which can adversely affect the value of international sales and earnings. The use of derivative instruments to hedge against these risks may not fully offset the financial impact of unfavorable currency movements. The company also faces credit risk related to its investment portfolio and trade receivables, particularly in international markets.

SEC Filing: Apple Inc. [ AAPL ] - 10-K - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: Amazon Is Maintained at Market Outperform by Citizens
Sharpie maker Newell Brands' Q3 sales miss on trade disruptions
data.description:
Overview

  • Newell Brands Q3 net sales declined 7.2%, missing analyst expectations

  • Normalized EPS for Q3 was $0.17

  • Net income was $21 mln, compared to a net loss of $198 mln last year

Outlook

  • Company expects Q4 international business to return to growth

  • Newell Brands updates full-year 2025 normalized EPS to $0.56-$0.60

  • Company estimates $180 mln incremental cash tariff cost for 2025

Result Drivers

  • TRADE DISRUPTIONS - Co faced significant trade disruptions, impacting sales, but implemented strategic measures like sourcing changes and pricing actions to mitigate effects

  • INVENTORY ADJUSTMENTS - Reduced retail inventory levels and moderated demand following tariff-driven pricing actions affected sales

data.title: Scor Shares Drop After Underlying Results Disappoint
data.description:
By Nina Kienle

Shares in Scor dropped after the French reinsurer posted weaker underlying third-quarter results.

In morning trading, shares trade 7.6% lower at 27.90 euros. They are 18% higher in the year to date.

The Paris-listed group said Friday that in the three months ended Sept. 30, it swung to a net profit of 211 million euros ($244 million) from a loss of 117 million euros.

Annualized return on equity amounted to 22.1% compared to negative 10.2% in the prior year's period.

However, while these results beat expectations on a headline level, the underlying details don't appear as favorable, JPMorgan analysts said in a note to clients.

"We find ourselves slightly disappointed," Jefferies analysts said. Among further reasons, the results stem largely from a lack of natural catastrophes, as well as property and casualty margins that were lower than expected and the life and health business noting higher onerous contracts, they said.

The company reported a fall in insurance revenue to 3.71 billion euros from 3.94 billion euros. Gross written premiums fell 8.3% to 4.57 billion euros, it added.

Its property and casualty business had a combined ratio--a measure of underwriting profitability--of 80.9%, against last year's 88.3%.

Scor said its estimated group solvency ratio stood at 210% at the end of the quarter.

It kept its dividend at 1.8 euros a share for 2024.

Write to Nina Kienle at nina.kienle@wsj.com

data.title: Rupee holds above record low on state bank dollar sales, ends month flat
data.description:
By Jaspreet Kalra

The Indian rupee fell on Friday but managed to hold above its all-time low on the back of intermittent dollar sales by state-run banks that also helped the currency end the month on a quiet note.

The rupee had rallied to a peak of 87.6250 earlier this month following heavy-handed intervention by the central bank, but has since shed those gains to once again hover close to its record low of 88.80, hit in late-September.

The currency ended Friday's session slightly lower at 88.7650 and was little changed month-on-month.

India's benchmark equity indexes, the BSE Sensex and Nifty 50 , were both down 0.4% each, tracking weakness in Asian peers, but were set to end October over 4.5% higher - their best monthly gain since March.

While traders expect the Reserve Bank of India to continue keeping a lid on rupee volatility, the broad bias is geared towards depreciation in the absence of clear progress on a U.S.-India trade deal.

A pact between New Delhi and Washington is "very near," a senior government official said last week.

Elsewhere, signs of cooling U.S.-China trade tensions helped support Asian currencies this week, even as a hawkish tilt in the U.S. Federal Reserve's commentary boosted the dollar and U.S. bond yields.

"Measures of FX volatility have fallen to fresh year to date lows this week highlighting that current market conditions remain supportive for FX carry trades," MUFG said in a note.

Carry trades involve borrowing low interest currencies to buy currencies with better yields.

The dollar index was last at 99.54, on course to end the month 1.8% higher, while Asian currencies were mostly stronger. The rupee was down 1% for the week.

Traders will keep a close watch on portfolio flows related to initial public offerings next week that could help the rupee find modest relief.

data.title: HANZA’s CEO buys shares
data.description:
HANZA's CEO Erik Stenfors has purchased 5,000 shares in HANZA for an amount of SEK 630,567.

The shares were traded on October 31, 2025.

After the share purchases, Erik Stenfors' holding amounts to 645,000 shares.

data.title: Coinbase holds edge in US crypto race even as rivals' public listings reshape landscape
data.description:
Key points:
  • Coinbase's premium pricing may face pressure from increased competition, analysts say
  • Listings of Gemini and Bullish point to maturing crypto market
  • J.P. Morgan sees M&A door open for Coinbase

By Manya Saini

Coinbase's first-mover advantage as the only publicly traded crypto exchange helped it top earnings estimates again, but competition is looming from clearer rules and newly listed companies, Wall Street analysts said on Friday.

The global crypto market has swelled to $3.7 trillion as institutional and retail investors pour money into digital assets. President Donald Trump has eased regulatory hurdles in the United States after taking office in January, driving bitcoin to record highs and paving the way for the industry's biggest players to tap public markets.

"While we think regulatory clarity for cryptocurrency and stablecoins will remain a positive tailwind for volume, it will also likely lead to additional competition," analysts at brokerage Morningstar said, adding Coinbase's premium pricing will likely face increasing pressure.

Gemini , the crypto exchange founded by Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss, listed on the Nasdaq in September. Rival Bullish went public in August, while Kraken is reportedly preparing to list in the first half of 2026.

The growing roster of public crypto exchanges signals a maturing market and poses the strongest challenge yet to Coinbase's dominance.

"Coinbase has established itself as the most institutionally trusted crypto company in the world. That said, we remain cautious on the retail outlook given rising competition and management's recent comments around customers wanting to trade more than just crypto," Piper Sandler analysts wrote in a note.

Coinbase ranks third among the top crypto spot exchanges globally on crypto analytics provider CoinMarketCap, trailing Binance and Bybit. It beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit after the bell on Thursday, underpinned by a surge in trading volume.

On a post-earnings call, Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said regulatory clarity in the U.S. and globally is starting to bear fruit, helping drive growth in the crypto sector, but added it means "that lots of new competition is coming in and so we need to make sure we're executing well".

The company has expanded its product portfolio through a string of acquisitions in recent years, including a $2.9 billion deal for derivatives exchange Deribit in May and a $375 million purchase of investment platform Echo earlier this month.

CFO Alesia Haas added "we've always faced competition", noting that Coinbase has continued to grow its market share, scale and trading volume.

Analysts expect Coinbase to continue its acquisition spree.

"We think the M&A door remains very much open for future acquisitions and strategic investments," J.P. Morgan analysts said.

"With a leading market position and solid industry and government relationships, we think Coinbase is in an advantaged position to submit competitive bids as an aggressive acquirer."

Shares of the crypto exchange were last up 5% in premarket trading.

data.title: Euro zone inflation eases a touch in October but core steady
data.description:
Euro zone inflation slowed a touch in October and continued to hover near the European Central Bank's 2% target, confirming the bank's message that the economy remains on the relatively benign path it projected earlier.

Inflation in the 20 nations sharing the euro currency slowed to 2.1% from 2.2% in September, in line with economists' forecasts in a Reuters poll, as quicker services price growth was offset by lower energy costs, figures from Eurostat showed on Friday.

A closely-watched figure on underlying inflation, which excludes volatile food and fuel prices, meanwhile held steady at 2.4%, defying expectations for a slowdown, as services inflation picked up to 3.4% from 3.2%, offsetting a drop in industrial goods inflation.

The ECB held interest rates steady on Thursday, arguing that inflation was on target and some of the worst risks related to economic growth had declined, keeping the bloc on a path for acceptable, if unspectacular, growth.

The ECB sees inflation dipping below 2% next year before a rise back to target in 2027, an outlook that was supported on Friday by a separate ECB survey, which is often a key input into policy deliberations.

This relatively healthy inflation outlook is a key reason why economists think the ECB is done cutting interest rates and financial markets only see a 40% chance of one last cut by the middle of next year.

The bank has already lowered rates by a combined 2 percentage points in the year to June and given long lags in policy transmission, this is still filtering through to the real economy.

Still, some policymakers argue that risks are skewed towards inflation going too low. They say that prices will dip below 2% early next year on statistical base effects and this could change firms' price expectations, making low inflation self-fulfilling.

But others say that the economy has performed better than feared and a raft of surveys, including the ECB's own poll of companies, is pointing to improved activity.

This improvement should alleviate some of the fears about the economy and limit downside risks to inflation, they argue.
